alert.note: Alert for Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 28 at 2:37PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM EDT FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Litchfield, Dutchess, and Ulster Counties. * WHEN...From 2 AM EDT Friday through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Longer durations of heavy rainfall from late tonight through early Saturday morning with total expected rainfall of 2 to 4 inches. Greatest amounts are expected across southern portions of Dutchess and Litchfield Counties. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster
